Students should also read their library books and complete the AR quizzes once finished.

Class code: YU6GQ2

Password: [REDACTED] (unless already changed)

Math 

Complete the Retaching and Red assessment pages from the math text book. These pages will help you with the test on Thursday.

I have added New Khan Academy lessons related to data.

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night
 at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills.

Language Arts (DUE TUESDAY)

Complete pages 118-119 in the Grammar Workshop Book.

Social Studies

Complete the Readworks story about branches of government.

Watch the videos about symbols and landmarks of USA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CJLGw0lkcdE
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t4ED9ytXPm4

Literary Fair Poster Project 

Check the attached template and examples
You have been given a presentation board. This board will be used to show your understanding of your book in a clear, creative, and visual way. Your work must be neat, colourful, well organised, and easy to read.

Middle of the Board (Center Section)

The centre of the board must include the picture you drew in art class. This picture should clearly relate to your book and show an important scene, character, or idea.

Under the picture, you must include the following information clearly written or typed:

Book title
Author
Publisher
Date the book was published
Make sure this information is centred and easy to read.

Left Side of the Board

The left side of the board must include the following sections:

Main characters (include pictures and names)
Setting (where and when the story takes place, include pictures)
Plot (a short summary of what happens in the story)
Each section should be clearly labelled with a heading. You may type your answers, but the font size must be large enough to read from a distance.

Right Side of the Board

The right side of the board must include:

The problem
The solution
Author’s purpose (why did the author write this book)
Why I liked the book
Five key words from the book with short explanations
Each section must be labelled and neatly organised. Typed work is allowed, but handwriting is also fine if it is neat and clear.

Theme and Design

Your poster must have a clear theme that matches your book and runs through the entire board.

For example, if your book is Harry Potter, you could decorate the board with small wands, stars, or magical symbols to separate sections. If your book is about sports, animals, mystery, or adventure, your decorations should match that idea.

Use colours, borders, shapes, and images to make your board eye catching and professional.

Pictures and Graphics

You must include pictures for the main characters and the setting. These can be printed or neatly drawn. Your board should be highly visual, not just text.

Your goal is to make your board graphic, creative, informative, and high quality.
